resources.string: Let\’s get you setup\nWhat shall I call you?
Use your fingerprint for signing transactions
Add an additional layer of security to the app by requiring your fingerprint for signing transactions.\n\nYou can always skip this step and set it up later in settings.

Congratulations on taking the first step towards your financial sovernty.\n\nPlaid Crypto Wallet™ gives you the tools you need to take your self-custody journey to the next level. Get started by creating a new wallet or navigating to the main screen.

The average price that you acquired this asset at. This is calculated based on the total amount of bitcoin the wallet received and the relative price of the asset at the time it was received.

You have not created any\nwallets yet
Not your keys, not your crypto! Your\nsecret pharse and private keys, never\nleave your device.

Asset transfer protocol is a premium feature provided to Plaid Crypto Wallet™ Pro users. It provides a convenient new way for you to transfer your assets from one wallet to another without sacrificing security.

ATP works by individually sending each of your UTXO’s to another location in “batches” or groups of up to 50.\n\nThis helps preserve Bitcoin\'s original purpose of providing pseudonymity to its users thus obfuscating your wallet\'s true total balance to onlookers.

Plaid Crypto Wallet™ puts you in the drivers seat by giving you the power to control how much you spend in fees, to how fast the transfer will happen.\n\nTake back your financial security by using ATP to move funds privately on the bitcoin network.

Your wallet is protected via a pin code
and fingerprint if enabled. Your wallet
data stored on the device is also AES
encrypted.

Need to move a large amount of funds or change wallets anonymously?

Use Asset Transfer Protocol (ATP) to send
all your funds to a new location without
sacrificing privacy.
Effortlessly top your bitcoin wallet\nfrom other cryptocurrencies, without\nleaving the app.

Batch Gap is a term that describes how many blocks are between each batch during an ATP transaction. For example, if you set your batch gap to 1 that means that there must be at least a 1 block "gap" between each batch that gets sent out.

i.e. each batch will take a total of at least 1 block (where the transaction was made) + 1 additional block before sending the next batch.

This can greatly increase the anonymity of your transfer depending on how large the gap is set.
Batch Size is a term that refers to the size or amount of utxos sent per batch.

To prevent network congestion, ATP will require there to be at minimum a 1 block gap/batch for every 10 utxos sent.

i.e. Suppose you have a total of 40 utxos you want to send in 2 batches. This would mean a 2 block penalty will be applied per batch (excluding the last one). In other words, ATP will send the first batch, wait for the batch gap + the penalty (if needed) to be satisfied. Then finally send the last batch.

If you would like to test out the functionality of this protocol, It's recommended to test it via a testnet wallet first before using real funds.

**
Please note the following:
	1. The penalty does not apply if the batch gap is >= to the penalty

	2. Asset transfers only execute one at a time per wallet.
**

Fee Spread is a term that represents the minimum and maximum fees that will be paid per batch. Once an ATP transfer is created each batch will randomly choose the fees to be paid per transaction based on the provided range.

If "Adjust To Network" flag is enabled, the network fee will be set to the current rate + the fee range.

i.e. If we assume the min/max fee is 1–5 and "Adjust To Network" is disabled, ATP will generate transaction fees within that range. However if you enable "Adjust To Network" and the current network rate is 20, ATP may generate transactions of the following values: 21, 25, 23, etc.
Not enough funds to complete transfer with given parameters
Not enough funds to complete transfer
In the next step you will see your seed phrase (%1$s) that will allow you to recover your wallet in the future in case you loose access to this wallet.
If I do not backup my seed phrase I understand that I could risk losing all my funds.
I Understand if I expose my seed phrase to anyone, at any point my funds can be stolen.
I Understand that it is solely my responsibility to keep my seed phrase secure.
If someone has your secret phrase, they will have full control of your wallet.

Jot down these words on a piece of paper in the order shown.\n\nIt is recommended that you write these words on a piece of paper and store them in a secure location to minimize the risk of an attacker gaining access to your funds.
Finally, let\’s give your wallet a name

This above settings allow you to change specific properties of your wallet. These settings do not apply when importing a wallet via public key.\n\nIf you do not know what they mean, it\'s best to leave them unchanged.
Your bitcoin wallet has been created.\n\nPlease note that it may take some time before your transactions (if any) will appear in the wallet dashboard screen.
This wallet has already been created.
Check out this transaction for amount: %1$s, with fee: %2$s.\nYou can view this transaction at: %3$s
Having trouble with this wallet? Drop us a line to get help.
Erasing wallet data, this may take some time.
Are you sure you want to erase your wallet? This action is irreversible, please be sure you have backed up your seed phrase and passphrases (if applicable).

Please Note

1. When a hidden wallet is created it's passphrase cannot be changed. If the passphrase is lost, entered in the wrong case, or forgotten, the hidden wallet will be lost forever along with any funds held within.

2. Keep the passphrase fields blank and set the account number to 0 to enter the default wallet.

3. For security reasons, only transactions related to a hidden wallet are saved. The private keys and passphrase are stored in memory and will be wiped upon app termination (you will have to re-enter the passphrase to restore the hidden wallet).
Hidden wallet limit reached!\nPlease upgrade to a pro subscription to create additional hidden wallets.

Change how your wallet syncs with the bitcoin network. Api syncing is significantly faster however if you are looking for a more secure solution.\n\nPlaid Crypto Wallet™ allows you to sync your wallet directly with bitcoin node operators. Please keep in mind that enabling core syncing may be significantly slower.

You are about to modify the wallet's default derivation path.

If you do not know what a derivation path is and or how they work. It may be best to leave this setting alone.

By proceeding you understand the risks of potentially losing access to your funds if the "account number" is lost. Otherwise swipe down on this dialog to go back.

Long press coins to view more info

How would you like to\nimport your wallet?

Public key import allows you to create a “watch-only” wallet where you can observe all incoming and outgoing transactions but cannot access the funds directly.\n\nEnter your public key below to create a “watch-only” wallet (usually zpub, xpub, or ypub).
You must enter a valid bitcoin address to import

Bitcoin is the first worldwide decentralized cryptocurrency that can be transferred peer-to-peer without a third party or middleman. It uses nodes to relay transactions and miners to validate and add them to the blockchain where all bitcoin transactions live.
